titleStmt.title: Despatch from Henry May to William H. Seward, May 5, 1864

bibl.title: Despatch from Henry May to William H. Seward, May 5, 1864
Despatches from United States Consuls in Gaboon, 1856-1888 T-466

text.body:
<div1 xml:lang="en" type="document"
<pb facs="20170615_111522"
Sir,
In my communication of the 7th of June I requested their permission might be granted one to wish America for the purpose of recruiting any health. The state of my health is such as to render a change of climate necessary. I shall therefore take passage upon the American Baique Greyhound. Which have this part on the inner bound direct fir crew sake; leave he affairs of this Commercial Agency in charge of Riv. Dna One Preston requesting you will confirrm his appointment as vice Commercial Agent at this place. Mr. Preston is a citizen of the United States was born in Massachusetts and has been for the past sixteen years in connection with the American Bound G.F.M at this place being will know here on in America as a man of in blemishe character. Enclosed will be found his oath of alligiance, Submitting the above for your consideration.
I have the honor to be your obedient Servant Henry May U.S. Commerical Agent.
